docs.title: Welcome to NoodleOps
docs.text: Created with mkdocs.org and the Mkdocs-Material theme.

docs.title: Mkdocs Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Mkdocs Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
docs.text: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

docs.title: Headings
docs.text: The following HTML <h1>—<h6> elements represent six levels of section headings. <h1> is the highest section level while <h6> is the lowest.

docs.title: Image
docs.text:
You can use the following syntax to include an image. Path of the image should be relative to the index.md file.

![Landscape](1.jpg)

You can also include image from external sources.

![Image](https://source.unsplash.com/random/600x400/?tech)

docs.title: Blockquotes
docs.text: The blockquote element represents content that is quoted from another source, optionally with a citation which must be within a footer or cite element, and optionally with in-line changes such as annotations and abbreviations.

docs.title: Blockquote without attribution
docs.text: You can use Markdown syntax within a blockquote, like bold, italics, links, code.

docs.title: Blockquote with attribution
docs.text: Don't communicate by sharing memory, share memory by communicating. — Rob Pike1

docs.title: Tables
docs.text:
Tables aren't part of the core Markdown spec, but Hugo supports them out-of-the-box.

Name Age 
Bob | 27

Alice | 23

docs.title: Markdown within tables
docs.text: Italics Bold Code italics bold code

docs.title: Code block with backticks
docs.text:
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>Example HTML5 Document</title>
</head>
<body>
  <p>Test</p>
</body>
</html>

docs.title: Code block indented with four spaces
docs.text:
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>Example HTML5 Document</title>
</head>
<body>
  <p>Test</p>
</body>
</html>

docs.title: Code block with Hugo's internal highlight shortcode
docs.text:
{{< highlight html >}}

Example HTML5 Document

Test

{{< /highlight >}}

docs.title: Inline code
docs.text: Use the backtick to refer to a variable within a sentence.

docs.title: Ordered List
docs.text:
1. First item
  2. Second item with some code in it
  3. Third item

docs.title: Unordered List
docs.text:
• List item
  • Another item with some code in it
  • And another item

docs.title: Nested list
docs.text:
• Fruit
  • Apple
  • Orange
  • Banana
  • Dairy
  • Milk
  • Cheese

docs.title: Other Elements — abbr, sub, sup, kbd, mark
docs.text:
GIF is a bitmap image format.

H2O

Xn + Yn = Zn

Press CTRL+ALT+Delete to end the session.

Most salamanders are nocturnal, and hunt for insects, worms, and other small creatures.

  1. The above quote is excerpted from Rob Pike's talk during Gopherfest, November 18, 2015. ↩
